Angle $ B$ of triangle $ ABC$ is trisected by $ BD$ and $ BE$ which meet $ AC$ at $ D$ and $ E$ respectively. Then:\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ \frac {AD}{EC} = \frac {AE}{DC} \qquad\textbf{(B)}\ \frac {AD}{EC} = \frac {AB}{BC} \qquad\textbf{(C)}\ \frac {AD}{EC} = \frac {BD}{BE}$\\
$ \textbf{(D)}\ \frac {AD}{EC} = \frac {AB\cdot BD}{BE\cdot BC} \qquad\textbf{(E)}\ \frac {AD}{EC} = \frac {AE\cdot BD}{DC\cdot BE}$
